dialogues.text: Grief does strange things to people. Aaron looks at him a little freaked out by his sudden appearance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you remember, I have something to talk to you about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there somewhere private we could go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. They walk away. The screaming continues as Jeff, frantica but slowly comes down the stairs re-tracing his steps and searching around for his lost bottle of pills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank and Aaron enter. Frank looks around the room a litt grief stricken himself. Aaron walks to the desk as Frank touches some mementoes he clearly remembers. Frank takes out his glasses and notices a manuscript on t with Aaron's name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you writing a novel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... yeah. Aaron takes the manuscript and moves it away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like your big brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually I'm the oldest. I was writing before.he was. I've had a few pieces published in the New Yorker. But now I'm mainly teaching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Well, you must be very proud of your brother then. Getting all his novels published. Aaron decides to move the conversation on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So anyway. What did you want to talk about? He motions for Frank to take a seat and sits across from

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father and I were very... close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Okay. That's good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we spent a lot of time together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well Dad was a fun guy. Frank takes an envelope out of his inside jacket pocket a takes some photos from the envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um... I've got some photos I want to show you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Frank passes the first photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's me and your Dad in Central Park in New York. Aaron looks at the photo curiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's us on Santa Monica Boulevard on Halloween... Aaron takes the next one, becoming more suspicious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, where did you and my dad meet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine is outside the bathroom banging on the door. We ca still hear Oscar moaning inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar. Are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar is laying in the bathtub. He has his head under the faucet with his mouth open. A drip falls into his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhh. He smacks his lips together and then opens his mouth and for the next drop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron is sitting with Frank. Frank passes him another pho

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's one of me and your father going to the premiere of "Dreamgirls". I was dressed as Deena and your father had to be Effie. Aaron looks at the photo of them dressed in drag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... I mean you have all these pictures, but he never said anything about you. This is the first I'm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank gives Aaron a knowing look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you know my father? Aaron looks around the room. There is a copy of "People Magazine" sexiest men issue on the table. He sees figurin male ballet dancers. It's getting clearer. He sees three Robert Mapplethorpe photos on the wall. There's a signed Griffin 8x10. Frank looks around waiting for him to get i Aaron looks at a framed movie poster for Australia with H Jackman. Aaron looks back at the picture. He gets it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God... Aaron jumps up and closes the study door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you really that shocked? Frank gestures around the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had no idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I'm sure he would have eventually told you, but I guess he wasn't sure how you'd react. Aaron shakes in disgust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uugg. Like this. Aaron gathers his senses. He has a thought and turns to F

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does my mother know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. And there's no reason why she should... Just as long as I get what's owed to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long pause. Aaron looks over at Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "What's owed to you"? FRANK . Well, obviously I should get something... I mean, your dad and I were lovers, and he left me absolutely nothing in his will. How do you think that makes me feel? Aaron fails to respond, because he's in too much shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you how it makes me feel cheap. Like some cheap piece of ass... I mean, I'm entitled to something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I want is a lot, but I'm not asking you for what I want. I deserve thirty thousand dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty thousand dollars?! I can't just give you thirty thousand dollars. My wife and I are trying to have kids--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father told me you were having trouble...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, your father promised to take care of me, and I made sacrifices to keep him happy. Aaron gets angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you can come in here, slander my father's name and show me a few photos of you and my dad dressed up going to see "Dreamgirls"? I saw "Dreamgirls" twice. I'm not gay. That's not proof of anything... "Steppin' to the bad side / Gonna take a mean ride."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron grabs Frank and pushes him against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not giving you anything but a-- Frank pulls out another photo and holds it up to Aaron's Aaron,releases Frank and snatches the picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I don't want to, but I will show these photos to your mother... Do you really want me to do that today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait here. He exits the study.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron closes the study door behind him and almost bumps i male mourners.

dialogues.speaker: MIDDLE AGED MAN
dialogues.text: Aaron, I was just telling George here how when we were boys together your dad used to love to make us all go skinny dipping. Aaron just stares at them. Then he moves toward the livin room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron crosses the living room which is full of people min around. He's gone pale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God, oh God, oh God... He's looking around for Ryan, but there's no sign-. -Mich watches Aaron walk around the room.

dialogues.speaker: INT. UPSTAIRS CORRIDOR SAME TIME
dialogues.text: Elaine is banging on the bathroom door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar. Open the door. Derek arrives behind her and leans in close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything I can do to help?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really, thanks. Derek moves over to face her and leans his arm on the doo coolly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess you've got it under control. Elaine ignores him and continues banging on the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar? Anguished noises emanate from the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar! Open the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what are you doing after the funeral? I've got Maxwell tickets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look... I'm busy. I don't have time for your shit. Now get the hell away from me! Derek looks hurt and storms off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan is talking to Martina.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .so you've never been to New York?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been with my parents once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's not really seeing New York. You have to come visit me. When's your birthday?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I turn eighteen next month.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. All star weekend is in New York this year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I know. Aaron approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan, I need to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not now, Aaron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me five minutes. Aaron pulls him away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron pulls Ryan into the garage and closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? What is it? Aaron lowers his voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That guy that was here before, that we didn't recognize...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy in the leather jacket?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about him? Aaron lowers his voice further.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I was just with him in the study, and... and he showed me some pictures...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So? He showed you some picture? What's wrong with that? I'm busy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pictures of him and Dad together at the premiere of "Dreamgirls". Ryan's face is blank. It's not registering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, is this going anywhere, Aaron?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan, he was Dad's lover!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? No, no, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy in the leather jacket just showed me pictures of him and Dad together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no. I don't believe that. My father is not gay. I've known him my whole life. And he's the most non-gay man I've ever met. Matter fact, he's so straight he makes me seem gay. And I know I'm not gay-- Aaron pulls out the picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uugg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uugg. I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uugg/Uugg. Aaron nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman and Derek are sitting at the table. Norman is look his wrist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can she be more interested in that idiot than me? Women. They don't know what they want! Norman's still examining his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sounds serious, doesn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pigment mutation. Derek gives Norman a disparaging look. Norman picks up so cake and takes a bite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooh, will you try this cake? I think it might have nuts in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shows his wrist) So?... Aaron's uncle says I might be allergic to nuts...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then don't eat nuts. Put the cake down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't not eat the cake. That's what I do when I'm stressed. I eat cake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet you won't eat it when your arm falls off. Norman sniffs the cake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you just try it and tell me if there's nuts in it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just do me a favor-- Norman is pushing the cake towards Derek's mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away from me. Derek gets up and walks off, leaving Norman spitting out cake. From under the table, Jeff pops up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You haven't seen a pill bottle around, have you? A Valium pill bottle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. But can you try this-- Jeff smiles nervously and goes back to his search on the Jeff slides across the floor past Uncle Russell sitting a other end of the table. An OLDER LADY turns to Russell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward and I watched the Tony Awards every year. We would get all dressed up and sip cocktails. I'm going to miss him so much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. The way you look, you won't be far behind. The mourner looks shocked. Jeff continues his search alon floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia is sitting quietly with Duncan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure we'll start soon. He looks toward the house and sees Norman exit. Duncan wa avoid him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a moment. Duncan gets up and heads toward the house. He passes Norm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor, I just have a-- Duncan doesn't stop, leaving Norman holding his wrist. No looks over and sees Cynthia. He sits next to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry... you know... about... you know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. I'll be alright. I know he's watching over me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think so?' I mean, there are a lot of fine ones up in heaven. Anna Nicole Smith's dead too, you know. might be watching over her. Norman sits next to Cynthia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Death is a terrible thing... Did you check to make sure he.was wearing shoes? I hear they steal the shoes. And I hope you took off his ring, 'cause if it's worth anything, someone is going to take that, too. Cynthia stares at Norman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before he died, did he have a rash? She gets up and exits. Norman notices Jeff's pill bottle ground. He picks it up and puts it in his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera closes in on the closed garage door. We hear h voices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't understand. If we don't give him the money, he's going to show Mom the picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Let me think, let me think. Ryan is trying to come up with a solution.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you should pay him the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, you think I should pay him the money? Where the hell is all your money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in debt up to my ass. I'm broke, man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So after paying for the funeral, the clothes, the catering... Now I'm supposed to shell out thirty thousand dollars? He's your father, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the oldest. Besides, you've been living off Mom and Dad long enough. You must have some money saved. You haven't paid rent in two years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have not been living off of them... I've been living with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No I haven't paid rent, but Dad hasn't worked in five years. Who do you think has been paying all the bills?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well if you've got money problems and I've got money problems, what can we do? Fuck him! Aaron shows Ryan the photo again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got to pay him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar is sitting on the toilet unrolling the toilet paper

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, yes. Keep coming. Join the others. Join the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine leans against the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar?

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Oscar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar? She tries the door. It's still locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar?

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Oscar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Oscar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Os...

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: .car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff frantically searches the bushes where Oscar pushed h looking for the pill bottle. He finds nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Russell is creating havoc at the buffet table. He's pushing people aside and poking them with his cane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, my nephew is dead and these bastards ate all the potato salad. Nearby mourners look appalled. The reverend looks over an Aaron and Ryan coming down the kitchen corridor. She appr them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reverend Davis appears in front of Aaron and Ryan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah! I think we're just about ready to start the service, so-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you mind giving us five minutes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. Aaron walks off followed by Ryan. He passes Michelle, who sitting on the couch. She stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is everything okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm really sorry, honey, but buying a condo is going to have to be put on hold, just for now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Babe, you know I wouldn't do this unless I had a good reason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the reason?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't got time right now, please. I'll explain later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron walks off to join Ryan, who's at the door of the st

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank is reading Aaron's manuscript. Ryan and Aaron enter

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You? So you and my--. You?! It's you. So when I called my father and he didn't answer, he was with you?! Aaron realizes what Frank is reading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, hey, hey! Aaron rushes over and takes the manuscript away from Fran

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing with my manuscript?! It's not ready. He puts it in the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you left it on a coffee table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that supposed to mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, when you put things on coffee tables, it's assumed it's for everybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It kind of is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we get to the point here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine by me. Aaron is now extremely irritated. He exchanges a look wit confirming that there's no other way out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I write this check, then that's it. You give us the photos and stay away from our mother. Deal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deal. Aaron sits down at the desk and reluctantly takes out his book. He starts writing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it your first one? Aaron stops writing and looks up at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The novel... it's a first draft?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, nothing. Aaron continues to write the check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tried writing once... Didn't work for me, either. I think it's just a gift. You either have it or you don't... It must be hard for you though, especially since your younger brother is such a great writer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father and I read "Black Hurt" together. Truly amazing. We loved it. He was so proud of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks... I guess... Aaron rips the check into little pieces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it. I can't do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron, what are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no way in the world I'm giving him my hard earned money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be stupid. Not today. I'll pay you back as soon as my money comes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He comes in today! Of all days, he picks the day of my father's funeral! Who the hell is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has the pictures!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what. Who cares what he's got. Let him show the world. Put it on facebook. I don't care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just get it over with. There's a long pause as everyone seems to be deciding wha do. Finally, Frank stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. This is on your head. Frank heads towards the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? No, wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan rushes to stand in front of the door, blocking Frank

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of my way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just discuss this a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing to discuss. Frank grabs the door and tries to open it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of my way. He tries to push past, but Ryan covers his mouth, mufflin cries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of my way. Move! Ryan restrains Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few mourners hear the commotion and the muffled voices. turn to look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan grabs Frank and wrestles him to the ground. Aaron wa absolutely shocked as Ryan and Frank roll around on the f Aaron jumps up and stands between them and the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan, what are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get off me! Ryan is trying to muffle Frank's screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron, help me! Ryan is holding Frank down and trying to keep him quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron, you got any rope or duct tape?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! I'm not a serial killer. I don't keep rope and duct tape in my pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well just grab something! (indicating with his head) There, from the curtains. Aaron grabs the cord that's tied around the curtains. He it over the wrestling duo, but Ryan's hands are occupied Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tie his legs. Aaron grabs his legs and in doing so falls on top of Fran well. As he wraps the curtain cord around Frank's legs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a really bad idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine leans against the wall listening as Oscar hums in bathroom. She slides down the wall and sits on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From a rooftop POV we see the window slide open and Oscar dripping with sweat and not wearing a shirt, lean out. He a deep breath of fresh air and listens to the birds. He climbs out the window revealing he's completely naked. stands on-the roof and lifts his hands to the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle comes up and sits next to Elaine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me about it... How's Aaron?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How would I know? He's been avoiding me all day. We're trying to get pregnant. But I can't really do that by myself, can I? I feel like I'm making him eat brussel sprouts every time we do it. Elaine looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy's father just died. Don't you think this is a bad day for sex?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you think I know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. At least your husband didn't ruin the funeral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a funeral, it's already ruined. When you start off with a dead guest of honor, how much worse can it get?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan and Aaron struggle with Frank, who's muffled cries a starting to fade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get that tie. Aaron grabs the necktie from off the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I supposed to do with the tie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you do with a tie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what to--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just stuff it in his mouth! Damn, I have to do everything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apparently everything but write a damn check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the door opens and Norman enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron, do you know what was in this cake, I- ANGLE ON: Frank who looks at Norman bug eyed hoping he'll

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut the goddamn door! Shocked, Norman does as he's told. It takes Norman a mome register that Aaron and Ryan are sitting on top of Frank. Frank continues screaming through the cloth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is going on? Who is that guy? Ryan thinks quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's having a seizure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just found some Valium outside. Would that help?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Great. Give him some. Frank shakes his head "no." Norman gets on his knees with guys and opens the bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. This should help. calm you down. Frank tries to protest, but can't. Ryan holds Frank's mou open as Aaron holds his nose closed. Norman pours a few p into Frank's mouth, then Ryan holds Frank's mouth shut. Suddenly the door opens again and Jeff walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you seen a little brown pill bottle lying around-- They all turn to Jeff. Frank looks at him, hoping this ti he'll get saved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman! I told you to lock the damn door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said "shut the damn door." Jeff locks the door and looks shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's having a seizure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is he all tied up? No one knows what to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar stands on the roof, naked, breathing in the fresh a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff, Aaron, Ryan and Norman are all kneeling over Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's blackmailing you? Over what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I could tell everybody, it wouldn't be blackmail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, just trust us. He's the bad guy. We'll explain later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do with him? Everyonerealizes they have no answer to this question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Ryan, what are we going to do with him? Ryan doesn't have any answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know?! Come on, you're the big writer. You're the one who came up with "Black Hurt." Dream up something where we all live happily ever after. We can't keep him tied up forever. How long do you think those Valium are going to last?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valium?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I found that bottle of Valium. We gave him a few to calm him down. Norman hands him the bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah shit! Jeff stands up and heads over to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? They all head over to Jeff. Frank looks extremely curious to know what's going on. Ev talks very quietly so that Frank can't hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thing is... those pills aren't really Valium. It's acid and... acid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar took one by mistake. That's why he's acting crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff, what the hell are you doing with this stuff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A friend left them at my place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What friend, Amy Winehouse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, you're telling us that Elaine's boyfriend, who knocked over our father's coffin, had just one of these things...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you gave him how many? Norman looks a bit guilty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five?! (looking at Frank) Poor bastard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought they were Valium. They all turn and look at Frank who is looking back at th increasingly concerned by whatever conversation they are and the pitying expressions on their faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we should call an ambulance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't do that. I'll go to jail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's right. If anyone finds out this guy's been force fed acid, we could all be arrested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what then? What's going to happen? Is he going to die?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... I don't think so... I doubt it.. Probably not...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The moment is broken by someone trying the door, followed knock.

dialogues.speaker: CYNTHIA, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Ryan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia is knocking on the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all back away from the door. CYNTHIA (O.S. Are you in there? They look at each other in panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as normal as possible) Be out in a minute, Mom. Ryan looks at Norman and Jeff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Norman and Jeff) Okay. We have to go out there. You two stay in here and watch him. Ryan closes the curtains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch him?! What do you mean, "watch him"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just make sure he doesn't escape. Lock the door behind us. We'll deal with him after the funeral. Aaron and Ryan open the study door leaving Norman and Jef take care of Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron and Ryan come outside trying to look as normal as possible. They see Cynthia standing with the reverend. AARON . How's it going, Mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reverend Davis wants to talk with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman locks the door behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reverend Davis tries to remain cool, but she's agitated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lookie here, brother. I've been patient. We all know it's a virtue, but I'm about done with patience. Now if we don't resume service soon, we're going to need to have a little conversation about my compensation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. So sorry. Um... can you just give us another five minutes? The reverend doesn't look too pleased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is everything okay, boys? Ryan and Aaron kiss their mother and walk off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron and Ryan enter and slam the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you just pay him the money?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you tie him up?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want Mom to find out?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is wrong with you? They start to argue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear their muffled argument through the door. Uncle Ru rolls up to Derek who is sitting at the kitchen table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your problem?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Women are my problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No such thing as having a woman without a problem. If they didn't have problems, do you think they'd let us touch 'em? Let me tell you something about women. Smarter than you think they are. But not as smart as they think they are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She acts like she doesn't care that I exist. I mean how can she not feel what I feel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh she feels it. She's playing hard to get. She wants you to work for it. Look, let me tell something about women. They want a man who can control them. I know they talk all this Oprah, Beyonce "single women" BS, but what they really want is an old school man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen here, boy. This is what you do: you walk up to her, slap her--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slap her? You want me to hit her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has not hitting her worked? Look, then you grab her and kiss her. The harder the better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure, 'cause that--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, man, I gotta shit. Where's the can? He rolls away quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman and Jeff are sitting in the study. Frank is on the tied up, breathing heavily and making gurgling sounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe you gave him five. Even if they were Valium, that's too many. I wouldn't give a guy five cough drops. Suddenly they hear the doorknob rattle. Norman and Jeff b look terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Jeff covers his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE RUSSELL, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Hello?! Neither Norman nor Jeff want to speak. They argue in gest Finally Jeff relents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE RUSSELL, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I need the toilet. Jeff and Norman both look panicked. Norman goes to the do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't you use the one upstairs?

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE RUSSELL, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I'm in a wheelchair, you idiot! How am I supposed to get up the stairs?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Norman and Jeff look at each other not knowing what to do

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE RUSSELL, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Open the damn door! Uncle Russell starts banging on the door with his cane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we going to do? They look at Frank who's starting to look high as a kite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll stick him behind the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just looking for the key. They pick Frank up and dump him behind the couch. Jeff stays with Frank to keep him quiet as Norman opens t door. Uncle Russell wheels himself inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is wrong with you people? I'm about to take a dump in my pants!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine is still standing outside the bathroom. Derek comes up to talk to her. Elaine's completely draine stressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want, Derek?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please don't make me go through this again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only reason you don't want to go out with me is because your dad likes me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. The reason I don't want to go out with you is because it was a mistake. I was drunk off my ass. You could have been a donkey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That wasn't a compliment. I'm saying I couldn't remember it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I remember every minute of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A minute, huh? That's why I don't remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it about this guy? What has he got that I haven't got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, well for one thing, he's responsible. He's caring. He's considerate. He's thoughtful. He's stable. He's--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar is leaning over the ledge playing with his spit and laughing uncontrollably.

dialogues.speaker: INT. GARAGE DAY
dialogues.text: Aaron and Ryan are still arguing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not the one who tied him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well somebody had to look out for Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been looking out for Mom since you got your book deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just can't get over it, can you? You're burning with jealousy because I left and did what you always wanted to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't leave because I had responsibilities.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't put it off on responsibilities. You spent three years on a novel and you won't even let anyone see it! What are you going to do? Wait until you're dead? You think you're going to be the Tupac of books?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least I'm not some hack writing crap. Mr. "Mama's Secret", Mr. "Black Hurt."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. "Out of Ink", Mr. "Blank Page." At least my crap gets published. Michelle enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron, what is going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle, please, not now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you acting like this? Fine. We don't have to have sex today, but the condo? Don't you want to get out of here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just tell her, Aaron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me what? Aaron closes the garage door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen... Do you remember the guy in the leather jacket?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I don't know how to say this, but... it looks like he and my father were having sex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? No. Not your father. With him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Your father was the straightest guy I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now he wants thirty thousand dollars or he's going to show everyone photos of them doing... stuff...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stuff like what? Aaron and Ryan share a look. Aaron shows Michelle the pic She reacts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman lifts Uncle Russell out of the chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry up! Norman is struggling to hold Uncle Russell up.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE RUSSELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Have you got me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I've got you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, quick, quick, quick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, I'm trying to see where the toilet is. He maneuvers Uncle Russell to the toilet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pants down. Pants down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can I do it? I'm handicapped. Norman reluctantly helps Uncle Russell pull his pants dow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. Alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drawers. Drawers. Take down my drawers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who calls them "drawers"? Norman pulls them down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I there? Am I there? Norman looks and sees Uncle Russell is right over the toi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, yes. Just sit down. Uncle Russell sits down on the toilet trapping Norman's h underneath and lets loose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooh, that's better. Norman pulls his hand out and looks at it in shock. ANGLE ON: Norman's hand has shit on the fingers. He start freaking out and screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff hears Norman and jumps up.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Ahh!!! Jeff goes into the bathroom to see what's going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff opens the door and rushes in, but is stopped in his by Norman's shitty hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahh!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugh! Norman, panicking, rushes to the sink, turns on the fauce blast and sticks his hand under the water. This causes a splashing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank peeks up from behind the couch. He's clearly high. his hands still tied, he struggles to get to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman frantically washes his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman? Norman? Norman still has his face down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, please. Just come off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman! Norman turns and we see he has shit splattered on his fac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Jeff points to his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You missed some. Norman turns slowly and looks in the mirror. He freaks ou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I think I've got some of it in my mouth! Norman desperately rushes to wash it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank is now up on his feet and running around like a rab animal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff pulls Norman up and shakes him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull yourself together. Would you rather get caught or have shit in your mouth?! Uncle Russell has fallen asleep on the toilet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank is running around the room. Through the door, we se Uncle Russell sleeping on the toilet. Frank jumps up and down on the sofa. He loses his balance falls on the coffee table head first. He cracks his head corner and falls straight down. Jeff and Norman rush out of the bathroom to find Frank ly the floor motionless, blood on his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no. Check him. Check him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, man, you alright? No response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check him again. Check him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man. Hey. Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wake him up. Wake up. Wake up. Wake up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's his name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Try Larry. Jeff looks at Norman, but he doesn't have a better idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shake him. Jeff bends down and shakes him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry, wake up. It's time to get up. From the bathroom, Uncle Russell starts to stir. Norman q closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's not Larry. Try something else. Pinch him. Jeff pinches Frank. Still no response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He must be breathing. He has to be breathing. Please God let him be breathing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff looks concerned. He checks for a pulse. He looks up Norman with an expression that tells us all we need to kn

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle walks into frame and stops at the coffin. Aaron Ryan stand on either side of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So that's it? We're just giving him all the money we've saved?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's not that simple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron refused to pay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come you couldn't pay, Ryan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not the point. Besides, the only reason Aaron tore up the check is because the guy started talking bad about his novel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your novel? Michelle looks confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You let him read your novel? You wouldn't let me read your novel. Are you screwing him, too? 'Cause Lord knows you're not screwing me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman comes out of the study and closes the door behindh He leans against the door, dripping with sweat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron and Ryan look over and see Norman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: Norman as he pastes a maniacal grin on his face crosses into the living room. As he moves through the thr mourners, they are all unnerved by him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Excuse me. Hi. Pardon me. Hi. The hugesmile never leaves his face. ANGLE ON: Ryan, Aaron and Michelle watching Norman, conce Norman approaches and stands on the other side of the cof

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman, why are you grinning like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Aaron and Ryan) Can you come to the study for a second? Aaron can see from Norman's face, and the sweat on his fo that something serious has happened. Then he sees Cynthia sitting in the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be back soon. Can you check on Mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. They exit. Michelle crosses to Cynthia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, are you doing okay? It's going to be alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you've never given life, child, how can you understand death?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff is leaning on the window. There's a knock at the doo

dialogues.speaker: AARON, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: It's Aaron. Jeff opens the door. Norman, Ryan and Aaron enter. Norman locks the door behind them. Aaron rushes over to the body

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit! Call an ambulance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean "there's no point"?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at him! He's dead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead, dead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there a "kind of" dead, Aaron?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell did you do to him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We didn't do anything!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well he was alive when I left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hit his head on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no. This is really bad. This is really, really bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty-five to life. Norman looks at his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what, I really have to be

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman makes his way to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm not the prison type. They'll kill me. Oh my God, I'm going to die. I'm going to die in prison. Oh my God, do you know how fast a rash spreads in prison? Aaron smacks Norman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull yourself together! Norman calms down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, man. After a beat, Ryan speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, no one here knows who this guy is. Nobody knows his name. They probably didn't even notice him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't notice him? He's four fucking feet tall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, all we have to do is get rid of the body. It'll be like he came and left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get rid of the body?! It took me two months to get rid of a couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did any of you happen to notice the size of Uncle Edward's coffin? Everyone looks at Jeff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to bury him with my father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?... I mean it's not like he's going to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not the point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to admit, it makes sense, Aaron. The coffin's there, the hole in the ground's there... He'll be gone, finished, end of story... Unless you have a better suggestion. Aaron desperately tries to think of an alternative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek and Elaine are sitting in the corridor. Elaine look drained of energy. Derek's smoking a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's funny. No matter what you say, I'm convinced we'll be together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, we all make mistakes... I used to be convinced I was going to marry Prince. What happened there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still could.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're an idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm serious. You only live once. You might as well do whatever it is that makes you happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but maybe I don't think of life anymore as all about me, me, me. Maybe I've discovered there's something outside of myself that I care about. And maybe you should, too. Derek looks hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's kind of cold. I care about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Derek, you care about you. You only care about me in relation to how I affect you. There's a difference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not true, Elaine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar is squatting down rolling his head around when he h Elaine's voice.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Derek, get over yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine moves over to the window. Derek follows her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! He slaps her on the butt. Elaine whirls around. Derek gra her on the arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the man for you, and you're coming home with me. He kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar turns to look at the window and sees Derek and Elai kissing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine pulls away and punches Derek in the face. He stagg back and sees Oscar in the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that?! Elaine turns around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar moves away from the window and further out on the l Elaine opens the window and sticks her head out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar! What are you doing? Get back here and put your clothes on right now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw you kissing him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't kissing him. I swear. Please, baby, put your clothes on. We're at a funeral! Derek sticks his head out the window behind Elaine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You cheater! You cheater! You're committing adultery!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to jump right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember you've got drugs in you. This isn't really happening. Oscar, look at me. She turns to Derek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of here! She pushes him back inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As mourners mill about the lawn we hear:

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I'm going to jump. I'm jumping. You're a cheater!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People gather. around and look up. We only see Oscar from waist up. ANGLE ON: Oscar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to jump. She's cheating on me!

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Oscar, please. Come back here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan, Aaron, Jeff and Norman are as we left them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's just no way we can do it. It's impossible. Suddenly there's a knock on the door. Everyone freezes.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Norman, it's Derek. Let me in. Everyone freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit. Put him in the bathroom. Aaron and Jeff drag Frank to the bathroom door.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Are you in there? Aaron opens the door and we see Uncle Russell still on th toilet. He looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that? Aaron slams the door. We can hear Russell's muffled shout coming from behind the bathroom door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman!! Why is Uncle Russell on the toilet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I forgot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could you forget?! What the hell is wrong with you?! Another loud bang on the door.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Aaron, open the door. Norman opens the door as Aaron runs over to keep Derek fr entering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron opens the door an inch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron, where's Norman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from behind the door) I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Oscar, he went crazy. He's-- Derek realizes that something weird's going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. Derek puts aside his curiosity for the time being.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Oscar's on the roof stark naked. He saw me kissing Elaine and now he's threatening to jump!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to go. Jeff rushes to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go out there. If he jumps, my sister is going to kill me. Jeff rushes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ryan and Norman) Wait here. Aaron follows Jeff, but he does not run. He walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff rushes through the empty room. Aaron walks behind hi slowly.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. BACK GARDEN DAY
dialogues.text: Jeff runs through the kitchen door and joins the mourners looking at Oscar on the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get back here. Be careful!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe I can fly! I believe I can touch the sky! ANGLE ON: Aaron who steps out and sees everybody watching

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine is still leaning out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar, come inside. We'll have some coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! He climbs up on the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar! She climbs out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mourners see that Oscar is naked. He stumbles. Everyb

dialogues.speaker: GASPS
dialogues.text: Aaron notices that everybody is captivated by the drama.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine follows Oscar on the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duncan sees Elaine on the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine, what are you doing?! Elaine sees Oscar climbing further up the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine! Elaine follows Oscar. Aaron realizes this is his chance. He heads back inside. Michelle catches him at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I can get rid of this guy, but I need you to stay out here and try to stop anyone from coming in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. I'll do what I can. She heads back to the crowd on the lawn. As Aaron goes th the doorway of the kitchen, Derek passes him on the way o the lawn to see what's happening.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Elaine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman is standing in the corner. Aaron knocks on the doo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: AARON, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: It's Aaron! Norman opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone's out in the garden... We've gotta move the body now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go! Ryan and Aaron grab Frank. As Norman runs out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman looks around and sees that it's clear. He goes bac the study and opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quick. Quick! Aaron and Ryan carry Frank out as Norman looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make sure no one comes in. As they disappear around the corner,, Norman closes the s door. He turns just in time to find Reverend Davis approa He intercepts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Reverend Davis) Hi! The reverend looks around, not knowing why Norman is bein especially friendly to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan and Aaron hurry across the living room carrying Fran

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman is blocking Reverend Davis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what made you decide to get your God on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm sorry, I really need to use

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to make a confession.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not a priest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay, 'cause I'm not Catholic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron and Ryan get to the coffin and Ryan opens it up. There's an intense moment as they look down at their fath the coffin. They both stop for a moment, speechless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron, we have to do this. Aaron looks up at Ryan and nods his assent. Ryan and Aaro up Frank and try their best to put him in the coffin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman still blocks the reverend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think God's favorite color is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll bet it's blue. The sky's blue. The seas are blue. And the winds blew, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan and Aaron are staring at the body. Frank is on his stomach, tops to tails with their father. Aaron looks at decides that it's just wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't leave it like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan looks down and laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a strange way, this might have been what he wanted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be serious for a second. They begin lifting him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman is doing his best to keep Reverend Davis at bay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron and Ryan have swiveled the body around so that Fran facing upwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you say I don't take anything seriously? You complain about me all the time, but if I didn't play the bad boy, you couldn't play the martyr.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron's so great, Aaron's so right, Aaron's so responsible. (back to normal) Why don't you try laughing and enjoying life once in a while? It might make you a better a writer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman is still talking to Reverend Davis. She looks like really doesn't want to be there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I must get to a phone. There's a man on the roof who's going to jump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm addicted to strip clubs. The shoes, the poles, the smell. I just like to take my money and throw it in the air. I like to make it rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine is stepping off the fire escape ladder and onto th peak. Oscar sits sadly on the roof peak with his back to crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar... Please don't do this... love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why were you with him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, you were! I saw you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek is laughing next to Jeff. We see the view from thei

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine finally gets closer to Oscar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll never be good enough. Not for your dad, and not for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar, please just come inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You go inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you're going to be a father. Oscar looks at her, shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm pregnant. We're going to have a child... ANGLE ON: Oscar and Elaine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're pregnant? Oscar is overcome with emotion. Elaine holds out her hand

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't be able to do it without you. Very slowly, a naked Oscar, walks toward her and they emb The crowd applauds. ANGLE ON: Michelle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about me?! I want a baby. Would somebody get me pregnant?! Everybody looks at Michelle. She smiles weakly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seeing Oscar is safe, Jeff is very relieved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman and the reverend hear applause. Reverend Davis hea back out to see what's up. Norman turns to check on Ryan Aaron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron and Ryan are just about to close the lid. They both down at their father one last time. Aaron takes a moment touch his father's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye, Dad. Ryan takes a long look as he closes the coffin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar turns toward the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're having a baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: General approval noises and applause come from the crowd. Duncan looks appalled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. Duncan heads toward the kitchen door. He passes a shocked looking Derek. Michelle follows and speaks loudly as Duncan is about to the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron?! Oscar's off the roof!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron and Ryan quickly shut the coffin a moment before Du enters the living room through the kitchen door and cross the way to the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to kill him. Jeff follows Duncan in, looks at the coffin, then looks a and Ryan questioning them with his eyes. They return the with silent assurance that the job is done. Michelle come

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, is he gone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God. Everybody breathes a sigh of relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine helps Oscar through the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Elaine! Elaine opens the bathroom door and Duncan enters. Elaine Oscar get dressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God you're safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You idiot! What the hell is wrong with you? Stay away from my daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Dad--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine, stay out of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm not staying out of this. Remember how I told you we were moving in together? Well, I lied. We're getting married. Duncan is shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're what?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're getting married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine, you don't have to marry him just because you're pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not marrying him because I'm pregnant. I'm marrying him because I love him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you love him? He's an idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, this is my life. If you don't like it, too bad. But if you want to keep me and my child in your life, you'd better change your attitude, especially about my husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine exits, taking Oscar with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye, Dad. They exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia walks up to Aaron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby, I really think we should start again now. Have you seen Uncle Russell? Aaron remembers where he is and looks at Ryan. They rush the study, passing Jeff. Jeff checks his pockets and real the pills are gone again. He goes off to find them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron and Ryan enter the study and head toward the closed bathroom door. They open it and find Uncle Russell sittin the toilet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is going on in this place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry, Uncle Russell. There was someone on the roof--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind that. What about that dead body you dragged in here? Aaron and Ryan feign ignorance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What dead body?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't mess with me. I know a dead body when I see one. I live in a retirement home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman sniffs his fingers, worried. In the background we Elaine entering the room with Oscar, now dressed, but sti looking a bit wired. People respond with scattered applau congratulations. Derek walks over and joins Norman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hear that? She's having a kid! Derek looks at Norman who's looking sort of distant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's your skin thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh that... It's probably nothing. I'm more worried about Hepatitis C after having Uncle Russell's shit in my mouth. I think I'm feeling yellow. Norman touches his skin as he walks away, leaving Derek confused. ANGLE ON: Jeff frantically looking for the pill bottle. H gives up and sits in a chair. ANGLE ON: Ryan is wheeling Uncle Russell into the room as moves to his seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you I saw the guy. He was dead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you did, Russell. We all did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! In the bathroom. Ryan offers a look to the other mourners indicating that Russell's a bit mad and shouldn't be listened to. ANGLE ON: Michelle comes over to Aaron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe what a nightmare today has been.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. It's been sort of exciting. Aaron looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a funeral, I mean...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, about the condo and the baby,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll work it out. Let's just get this day over with. Then we can worry about the rest of our lives. Aaron hugs Michelle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe I still have to do this eulogy... with everything I've just found out. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't change anything, does it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a thing. Reverend Davis approaches Aaron, looking at her watch and appearing flustered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to have to fly through this now. I already missed a funeral and two Christenings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want an open casket?

dialogues.speaker: AARON/RYAN/NORMAN/JEFF
dialogues.text: No! The reverend looks shocked at the reaction, but ignores i stands up at the front and speaks quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright! Everybody in their seats now! (she snaps her fingers) Hey, you, sit down. People settle into their seats. Ryan manages to squeeze i to Martina. He smiles at her, flirtatiously. Cynthia thro Ryan a look, and he gets up and goes to sit with her.

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND DAVIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (speaking very quickly) I'd like to apologize on behalf of the family for all of the distractions. I hope that everyone is settled and ready to continue with the service. Aaron, the oldest son, would like to say a few words about his father. Michelle gives Aaron an encouraging look as he makes his the front. Aaron clears his throat and prepares to begin. The room i absolutely silent. He takes a deep breath. ANGLE ON: The reverend nodding for Aaron to hurry up. ANGLE ON: Aaron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father... was an exceptional--

dialogues.speaker: BANG
dialogues.text: Suddenly, a loud banging emanates from the coffin. Everyo stares at it in stunned silence. Jeff looks over to Norma whose eyes are as wide as saucers. Aaron looks like a dee caught in headlights. He looks at Ryan who gestures to hi continue. He nervously struggles on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father was an exceptional man.

dialogues.speaker: BANG
dialogues.text: Everyone stares at the coffin in awe. Aaron bravely conti

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not only did he live for his family, but he was always there for others--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's someone in there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew it! I knew it! Suddenly the coffin lid flips off and everyone stares in as Frank sits up, looking like a crazy person, and babbli incoherently. Several people scream. Frank opens the other end of the c and looks at his dead lover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to cover) What the hell are you doing in my Dad's coffin? Frank starts grabbing at Edward's body screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward! Edward! Edward! Ryan, Norman and Jeff try to pull Frank out of the coffin he's holding onto the corpse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! No! Finally they get Frank out and carry him from the room. A passes Cynthia, the photos fall out of his pocket at her As Duncan closes the coffin again, Cynthia bends down and up one of the photographs and stares at it. Her face turn horror as she makes out the image. The noise in the room broken by Cynthia's furious cry. She drops the photos and at Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bastard! Cynthia tackles Frank and starts beating him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as she hits him) He was with you! Duncan picks up the photos. He shows them to Uncle Russel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always thought he had a little sugar in his tank. Everything has descended into total chaos until Aaron fin shouts across the room.

dialogues.speaker: MY FATHER WAS AN EXCEPTIONAL MAN
dialogues.text: Everyone, including Frank and Cynthia, looks at Aaron, st They all freeze. There's a long silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had his... shortcomings, but he took care of his family. He loved his family. He loved this house. He worked hard. All I wanted today was to show him how much we all loved and admired him. To give him the respect that he deserved... Is that really so much to ask? We all get so distracted by the... little things in life. We forget about the important things. Like the fact that we lost a great man. The mourners look up at Aaron with undivided attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So maybe he loved "Dreamgirls" more than most men. We don't know why a man makes the choices he makes. But I do know that my father made the best choices he could make. Life is complicated. We're just thrown here together in a world filled with chaos and confusion... and we do our best. And Dad did his best... Aaron looks over at the coffin. As.he speaks, we see shot Cynthia, Frank, Jeff, Norman, Duncan as they are moved by Aaron's words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He taught us to go for what we wanted in life, because you never know how long you're going to be here... And whether you succeed... or you fail... the important thing is that you tried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat. Michelle looks up at her husband with pride. We s the various other mourners looking at Aaron and listening

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So when you all leave here today, I want you to remember Dad for who he really was... A decent, loving man who never condemned anyone for how they lived. Who never cast disparaging remarks or held prejudices against race, gender... height. If only we could all be as giving, as generous, as understanding as my father... Even dead, my father has more character than everyone in this room. If I am half the man my father was, my child will be incredibly blessed. Aaron turns and walks out of the room. Everyone watches h Michelle follows him out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house has emptied out. All the cars are gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaron is laying on the couch, looking drained. Ryan comes the stairs. It looks like he's had some time to recover. walks over and takes a seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's Mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's resting. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've asked Mom to come live with me for awhile. It'll give you and Michelle a chance to breathe a bit, you know. Move and everything. Aaron looks at Ryan, surprised.
